name: DXI/EFS Configuration Parameters (FS and DB)
title: DXI/EFS Configuration Parameters (FS and DB)
body:
Overview

The vast majority of the configuration parameters are currently stored at DB level and accessible via UI under Options >> Platform cockpit >> root only:: System configuration and is only visible when logged in with the root account. 

This article is meant to shed details about the config parameters available in DXI/EFS.

Config file in file system

The file can be found here: [installation_path]/htdocs/conf/config.inc.php3
The file originally included all config variables but since EFS 10.0 most of the variables were moved to the database so they are configurable via the EFS admin area.

The following config variables still have to be configured in the config file:

  • Database connection details

    • dbhost

    • dbuser

    • dbpasswd

    • dbname

    • dbport

    • dbsocket

  • GP name, important as fallback for http_host, usually corresponds to the base url of the installation

    • gp_name

Config in the database

The config variables are stored in database table config_variables and in backup table config_variables_backup.

As some of the values are serialized, it is not suggested to change the values via the database directly but to use the user interface in the EFS admin area instead!

The list below is for reference and is NOT exhaustive.

NAME DESCRIPTION DEFAULT VALUE DEFAULT FE HEAL
additional_global_content_handler_types add custom types of content handlers to global contenthandler list   array ( ) no no
additional_mail_header additional Mail-Header for all mails sent from the installation; key = name of the header, value= value of the header. You can use the following wild cards in value: #pid#","#sid#","#uid#","#x_key#","#dt#","#numtry#","#mail_id#","#mail_subject#","#admin_uid#", Example: additional_mail_headers = array("X-job" => "#pid#.#sid#", "X-test" => "foo") any array ( ) no no
admin_login_ip_range Which IP Adresses are allowed to login to the admin area any IP address and IP address range 1.1.1.1-255.255.255.255' no no
admin_session_highsecurity_timeout Timeout for admin session if high security mode is enabled. Min value: 60 seconds value in seconds 900    
admin_session_timeout Timeout for admin session, also valid for other login areas, e.g. report, translations etc. value in seconds 7200    
allowed_rank_number Max number of items possible in ranking question   18    
allow_ssl2 allow ssl v2   FALSE    
balancer_url balancer URL to sync the memcache with. Do not set in case of single servers. dev=false productive="http://lb:8888/" http://lb:8888/'    
basepath_frameworks common frameworks basepath (does include ZF and other frameworks used by EFS)   /opt/pdp/opst/apps/efsframeworks/'    
branding Show the Questback branding   FALSE    
branding_customizing Set who is able to customize the installations’ branding templates, i.e. the "Powered by Questback" subline at the bottom of the installations’ admin areas, survey templates and panel websites. If set to "root user" or "admin user" the desired changes can be made under Options -> Branding. Not customizable,Customizable by root user, Customizable by admin user Customizable by root user'    
brute_force Amount of failed logins after which brute force protection is enabled   6 no no
brute_force_time Amount of time the user is disabled after brute force protection was enabled   1800    
compress_mysql_connection enable mysql compression false,true FALSE    
cookie_policy_admin_expiration Specifies the expiration of cookie which contains the acceptance of EFS Cookie Policy for EFS Admin Area. Default value is 90 days. value in seconds 7776000    
cookie_policy_survey_expiration Specifies the expiration of cookie which contains the acceptance of EFS Cookie Policy for surveys (currently Responsive Layout 2 only). Default value is 90 days. value in seconds 7776000    
csrf_length The length of the CSRF token   8    
csrf_mode Activates the CSRF (Cross-Site-Request-Forgery) checks in the whole system false, true FALSE    
csrf_send_mail   true = sending mail to -> efs_errornotification_recipients::getMail('TOKEN_ERROR') false -> no mailing FALSE    
csrf_whitelist List of controllers an action which should been whitelisted for the CSRF checks   array ( 'login' => '*', 'logo' => '*', )    
customer_accesslevel Login to Customer Center 0=>no access 1 => limited (for test installations) 4 => full 4 no no
customproject_name Optional custom project name   ' no no
customproject_path Optional custom path to custom projects   ' no no
custom_login_logo optional logo for login screen (image dir: $ __basepath_custom . "images/login/custom.jpg")   ' no no
custom_modules include the follwing modules from $__basepath_extensions ("projekte") into the EFS main menu. This can be used for adding custom modules from product customizing team to the admin section   array () yes  
custom_sms_supplier custom sms supplier   ' no no
dbreport_anonymize Anonymize the DB report? false/true FALSE no no
dbreport_sender Alternative sender address for dbreport if this variable is empty, the fallback address is www@questback.de www@questback.de' no no
dbsession information of optional db session database (performance)   array ( 'dbhost' => '', 'dbuser' => '', 'dbpasswd' => '', 'dbname' => '', 'dbport' => 0, 'dbsocket' => '', )    
dbslave information of optional slave database, slow queries will be executed on slave overwrite default timeout (1 sec.) before queries fallback to master. Only values > 0 are used, if you want endless timeout use $__dbslave["force"] flag. array ( 'dbhost' => '', 'dbuser' => '', 'dbpasswd' => '', 'dbport' => 0, 'dbsocket' => '', 'force' => false, 'master_fallback_timeout' => 0, )    
debuglevel controls debug output 0= Live installation (no debug output) 1=Development installation (debug output) 2=Test installation (output of some information) 2 no no
debug_memcache_read debug memcache read access, all values will be written to mysql log false, true FALSE    
debug_memcache_write debug memcache write access, all values will be written to mysql log false, true TRUE    
debug_webservices write incoming xml into mysql log? false, true FALSE    
demo_teaser_url URL for demo teaser used by demo dialog. e.g "https://pm.customervoice360.com/uc/pop/?"   https://pm.customervoice360.com/uc/pop/?'    
dev_mode Specifies whether the build files or the raw files for canJs should be loaded. false, true FALSE    
disable_feedback disable the feedback button false, true FALSE no no
disable_memcache disable memcache Performance risk! false, true FALSE    
disable_password_mails the login shouldn`t send any mails (customer wants to handle that for whatever reason) false, true FALSE    
disable_replication_wrapper disable the INSERT|REPLACE INTO SELECT-wrapper for database queries (increases performance, but may have replication issues) used in efs_database_batch_mode false, true FALSE no no
efs_http_client_requests_limit     array ( )    
efs_setup_version the version number the installation was INITIALLY setup with. The version number defined here will partly define the installation`s compatibility and feature set. Deprecated features will be turned off completely if the installation is very new but they will be avalable and marked as deprecated if the installation is old and might make use of the deprecated features. DO NOT INCREASE THE VERSION NUMBER WITH EVERY UPDATE OR UPGRADE BECAUSE THIS MIGHT CHANGE THE BEHAVIOUR OR BREAK COMPATIBILITY. PLEASE ONLY SET THIS VALUE IF IT IS NOT YET SET!!! if the installation started as an OPST 4.0, please use a value of 4.0 here. If it started as a 5.3, please use 5.3 etc. 10.8 no no
elasticsearch_configuration Enter hosts and ports your elasticsearch configuration.   array ( 'connections' => array ( 0 => array ( 'host' => 'elasticsearch', 'port' => 9200, ), ), 'retryOnConflict' => 5, ) no yes
elasticsearch_enabled Enable elasticsearch for this installation? false, true TRUE no yes
enable_watermark enable watermark in surveys, for demo installations false, true FALSE no no
error_dump activate this to get errors displayed on screen immediately. As errors get printed out directly, this might break both layout and functionality. Never use this on production installations. Only use for development false, true FALSE no no
error_logfile put in the absolute filename of an error log file in here. the file must be accessible by all EFS front ends (i.e. put it in NFS) and writable by the web server & CLI users. Never use this on production installations as this logfile might get very big, will not be rotated and is not race-condition safe etc. Only use for development!!   ' no no
error_recipient put in an email address or comma separated addresses here that should receive errors triggered on the installation. warning: you might be spammed blank= failed-queries@questbackcom ' no no
error_threshold how many error mails by type should be sent at most from an installation. Capping the number of mails will reduce spam sent by completely broken installations (e.g. if hard-drive is full etc.)   2 no no
export_have_icharts allow icharts export format for results data exports false, true FALSE    
export_jobmaker_behaviour Queueing behaviour for the EFS exports. use this for high-traffic/volume installations. this variable deprecates the (bool) $__export_skip_jobmaker variable which has been removed from the sample config in EFS > 8.1 0 = default behaviour: survey export jobs will be queued if they contain loop data. this was the built-in EFS behaviour since v3.4 1 = skip queue: export jobs will never be queued. use this for development installations 2 = force queue: all export jobs will be queued. 0 no no
export_max_rows_per_file Limit of rows per export file in export, useful for huge installations false = no limit >0 = limit of rows per file. 0 no no
export_temp_sample_data If true then during result data export the temp sample_data table will be used in order to increase performance. true, false FALSE    
facebook_enabled enable facebook for this installation? false, true FALSE no no
fallback_sender fallback_sender in mail form   www@questback.de' no no
force_ssl force ssl, means that URLs will be opened using https (used in auto_config_opst.php) false, true FALSE yes no
force_ssl_area force ssl for specific areas only   array ( ) yes no
gpg_executable do we have gpg on this installation? false, true FALSE    
gp_id ID of the installation entry in Globis   '    
gp_type_l types of question types available on this installation   array ( 998 => 'gl_html', 999 => 'gl_img', 111 => 'gl_111', 112 => 'gl_112', 113 => 'gl_113', 121 => 'gl_121', 122 => 'gl_122', 131 => 'gl_131', 132 => 'gl_132', 141 => 'gl_141', 142 => 'gl_142', 143 => 'gl_143', 144 => 'gl_144', 311 => 'gl_311', 312 => 'gl_312', 313 => 'gl_313', 321 => 'gl_321', 322 => 'gl_322', 340 => 'gl_340', 341 => 'gl_341', 342 => 'gl_342', 351 => 'gl_351', 361 => 'gl_361', 362 => 'gl_362', 363 => 'gl_363', 364 => 'gl_364', 411 => 'gl_411', 511 => 'gl_511', 521 => 'gl_521', 522 => 'gl_522', 911 => 'gl_911', 921 => 'gl_921', 611 => 'gl_611', 621 => 'gl_621', 641 => 'gl_641', 661 => 'gl_661', )    
has_receipt_admin if set to false, only gp users will see the receipt admin menu item if the module is active. if set to true, all privileged users will see it. this option can be used to turn off the receipt administration for all non-gp users (this is also the default) false, true FALSE no no
has_routing_plugin use custom routing plugin in custom/routing/plugin.inc.php to execute custom request handling/redirections? false, true FALSE no no
has_webservices this will activate or deactive the web service and service layer configuration GUI in the admin section. If set to false, the services are still accessible but not configurable in the admin section false, true FALSE no no
high_security enable High-Security mode In most cases oyu alwo want to enable force_ssl! false, true FALSE yes no
http_only_cookies allow Javascript access to cookies or make cookies http-only? note: cookies will be http-only always if high_security mode is activated, regardless of the config value. false, true TRUE   no
http_proxy     proxy:8080'    
hurricane_ad_hoc_password Password for ad_hoc mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   '    
hurricane_ad_hoc_port Port for ad_hoc mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   1030    
hurricane_ad_hoc_server Server for ad_hoc mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   localhost'    
hurricane_ad_hoc_user User for ad_hoc mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   '    
hurricane_snailmail_password Password for snailmail mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   '    
hurricane_snailmail_port Port for snailmail mail delivery (only inf Hurricane MTA is active).   1030    
hurricane_snailmail_server Server for snailmail mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   localhost'    
hurricane_snailmail_user User for snailmail mail delivery (only if Hurricane MTA is active).   '    
ignore_tests Which unittests shall be ignored? array("efs_test_installation"=>array("test_memory_limit"),"survey_test_installation"=>array("test_memcache_extension"), ...); array ( )    
installation_type installation type survey, panel, employee, leadership survey' no no
instlist_report_with_debuglevel in use in globis_report() in dbreport.php If set to "true" allows process GLOBIS-Sync for installations with $__debuglevel > 0. false, true FALSE no yes
interviews_sender set alternative adresses to receive the interview count blank= fallback de.support@questback.com de.support@questback.com'    
lang default setting for EFS admin language en, de en' no no
locale locale information for installation DE_de, AT_de, CH_de, CH_fr, GB_en, US_en, FR_fr, SE_sv, NO_no, FI_fi GB_en' no no
lock_change_password If the lock is active the user's password can only be changed once within 24 hours. false, true FALSE no no
log_posts log post data AND content of delivered survey pages for specific projects/surveys to the database logfile. For example, to start logging for survey 123, use $__log_posts=array(123=>true);   array ( )    
lua_lib_path library path for lua blank= autodetect '    
mail_delete_interval interval when mail recipients should be deleted (in months)   6    
mail_extra_values additional value that can be selected within mail form. If value is an array   array ( )    
mail_parser_blocksize     100    
mail_spf_check     TRUE

mobile_layout_decision_order     array ( )
